Ordo.media

Rubrics for Building a Liturgical Calendar

Christmas Time

1. Should the Sunday within the Octave fall on the Feast of St. Thomas of Canterbury or of St. Sylvester, the Office of the Sunday is recited, with a commemoration of the respective Feast occurring. The Office of the Sixth Day of the Octave is said on December 30.

2. If a Sunday fall on the Feast of St. Stpehen, St. John, or the Holy Innocents, the Office of the Sunday is said on December 30 as its proper day.
